result.execSummary:
The defendant Dionisio B Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must sign up for probation within 72 hours.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must have no unsupervised contact with M.T.H. or A.R.H. without approval by probation agent. Any supervisor, including their mother must be approved by the probation agent. Until such approval is obtained, he is to have no contact with the children.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent including, but not limited to, anger management counseling, domestic abuse counseling and any other counseling the Agent believes is in his best interest and protecting the public.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

Defendant Dionisio B Lopez in court with attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:23 Language Line called - Interpreter #201795 sworn.  Attorney Perrin recites agreement.  State relates.  Counts 1 and 2 amended to misdemeanor disorderly conduct 947.01.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Counts 1 and 2 as amended.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Perrin relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 1 years Probation - Must sign up for Probation within 72 hours
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent including, but not limited to, anger management counseling, domestic abuse counseling and any other counseling Agent believes is in his best interest and protecting the public.
Must have no unsupervised contact with M.T.H. or A.R.H. without approval of his Agent.  Any supervisor, including their mother, must be approved by Probation Agent.  Until such approval is obtained, he is to have no contact with the children.
Court costs and assessments.

COVERS 15CF107 AND 15CF108.
15CF107: Defendant Dionisio B Lopez in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:06 Language Line called.  Interpreter #201834 Sworn.
Attorney O'Boyle relates he has Information that is not dated or signed with 4 counts on it.  Two that relate to Defendant Lopez.
State relates signed copy was filed.  Court Clerk makes copies of signed and filed Information for Attorney O'Boyle.
Attorney O'Boyle relates he has previously discussed the unsigned Information with defendant and the signed Information is the same.  Defendant waives reading of Information and pleads not guilty to both charges.
Plea Hearing set for 09-30-2015 at 2:00 p.m.
Interpreter released at 3:18.

15CF108: Defendant Christina M Hart in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel. Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hoel relates she has Information that is not dated or signed with 4 counts on it.  Two that relate to Defendant Hart.
State relates signed copy was filed.  Court Clerk makes copies of signed and filed Information for Attorney Hoel.
Attorney Hoel relates defendant waives reading of Information and enters not guilty pleas to both charges.
Plea Hearing set for 09-30-2015 at 2:00 p.m.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
